messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: On December 3, DET. X. Y. Foster was dispatched after a series of car thefts at the Grand Plaza. Key informants were Mr. Gray, a valet, and Ms. Turner, a car owner. FORWARD COPY TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION. INFORMANT DOCS. Lt. Z. A. Howard - OPERATIONS Det. Foster, Jr. .. INVESTIGATIONS. Detective B. C. Adams and Detective D. E. Barnes were brought in. WHITE 19:15 Car Thefts Mr. Gray described the suspect's appearance, and Ms. Turner identified her stolen vehicle. Tracking. Technician Wendy activated car GPS systems. CONTINUED FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Foster Jr, Det. Adams, Det. Barnes OPERATIONS Lt. Howard INFORMANT Turner, Melissa 55 Maple Drive, Grand, Nevada 192-835. 94060. WHITE 19:15 Car Thefts By 9:55 PM, Detectives Foster, Adams, and Barnes, guided by Lieutenant Howard, located two stolen cars using GPS. Captain F. G. Jackson proposed sting operations. Sergeant H. I. King and Sergeant J. K. Lawson liaised with car insurance companies. By 11:20 PM, three suspects were apprehended. FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Foster Jr, Det. Adams, Det. Barnes OPERATIONS Lt. Howard AFFIDAVIT - Car Thefts Report 1) Vehicle Descriptions 2) Witness Statements 3) F.I.R. 4) GPS Logs 5) Valet Shift Roster (6) Other Details LINE UP INFO ASSISTANT CHIEF DEPUTY IN CHARGE L. Brown G.P.P.D. 29.115 P68 3175 Gray, MICHAEL NAME: ADDRESS: TELEPHONE: 175-3475 DETECTIVE: X. FOSTER ITEM: 68-5400- 106 CRIME: 19:15 IDENTIFICATION NUMBER 84025 - CONFIRMED Jane Doe DATE 6/10/24 FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION CONTINUED.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: DET. X. Y. Foster  Officer Context: On December 3, DET. X. Y. Foster was dispatched after a series of car thefts at the Grand Plaza. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Lt. Z. A. Howard  Officer Context: Lt. Z. A. Howard - OPERATIONS Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Detective B. C. Adams  Officer Context: Detective B. C. Adams and Detective D. E. Barnes were brought in. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective D. E. Barnes  Officer Context: Detective B. C. Adams and Detective D. E. Barnes were brought in. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Technician Wendy  Officer Context: Tracking. Technician Wendy activated car GPS systems. Officer Role: Technician (from the Crime Lab) Officer Name: Detective Foster  Officer Context: By 9:55 PM, Detectives Foster, Adams, and Barnes, guided by Lieutenant Howard, located two stolen cars using GPS. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Adams  Officer Context: By 9:55 PM, Detectives Foster, Adams, and Barnes, guided by Lieutenant Howard, located two stolen cars using GPS. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Barnes  Officer Context: By 9:55 PM, Detectives Foster, Adams, and Barnes, guided by Lieutenant Howard, located two stolen cars using GPS. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Captain F. G. Jackson  Officer Context: Captain F. G. Jackson proposed sting operations. Officer Role: Captain Officer Name: Sergeant H. I. King  Officer Context: Sergeant H. I. King and Sergeant J. K. Lawson liaised with car insurance companies. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Sergeant J. K. Lawson Officer Context: Sergeant H. I. King and Sergeant J. K. Lawson liaised with car insurance companies. Officer Role: Sergeant
